responsibilities: Build and facilitate non-consortium-based research collaborations with researchers in non-AI scientific fields to explore innovative applications of ML tools.
Co-build ML tools and models for scientific use cases, co-developing solutions and publishing pre-trained models or datasets tailored to these domains.
Educate and engage with the scientific community through tutorials, workshops, and open-source contributions to bridge the gap between ML and traditional sciences.
Foster strategic partnerships and community research initiatives with academic institutions and organizations to advance interdisciplinary innovation and adoption.
Work with industry or academic partners early in the research process and guide collaborations to the final release.
qualifications: Ability to experiment with different models and figure out how to have the most impact.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment.
Strong communication skills to efficiently join forces with other teams.
Deep understanding of technical domains and willingness to delve into details.
analysis:
The job involves building and facilitating research collaborations to explore innovative applications of machine learning (ML) tools in non-AI scientific fields. It also includes co-building ML tools and models for scientific use cases, which suggests a focus on developing and applying machine learning models. The responsibilities mention publishing pre-trained models or datasets, which could imply working with pre-trained language models or other types of ML models. However, there is no explicit mention of Generative AI or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities.

The skills required include the ability to experiment with different models, which could involve working with various types of ML models, including language models. However, the skills do not specifically mention Generative AI or LLMs.

Overall, while the job involves working with machine learning models and tools, there is no direct indication that it specifically involves Generative AI or language models. The focus seems to be more on interdisciplinary applications of ML in scientific fields rather than on GenAI or LLMs specifically.
